# Your turn: meet your neighbors!

`r set.seed(20190709); emo::ji("fantasy")` `r set.seed(20190712); emo::ji("fantasy")` `r set.seed(20190711); emo::ji("fantasy")`

# Your turn: Course materials

https://github.com/dicook/SISBID

- __Download a zip archive__ of the workshop files which contains all the code files, Rmarkdown files, and data for this workshop. __Unzip the file__ and __rename__ it `SISBID`
- __Double-click SISBID.Rproj:__ the R project helps organise your work over these next few days. 

![](projectname.png)

---
# What's in the zip?

- One folder = one module
- Each folder contains 
    - `r anicon::nia(".r file of code, use this to follow along", colour="#FA700A", anitype="hover")`
    - `.Rmd` file containing code and explanations that makes the slides. You can use this if preferred, working chunk by chunk, if you want to work see the explanations along with the code. 
    - other stuff (css style, images) that you can ignore.
    
`r anicon::nia("Please run, edit and change the code as we go! Experiment, break and fix.", colour="#B78ED2", anitype="hover")`

# Refresher

The three main locations that we will draw packages from are CRAN, Bioconductor and github.

From CRAN

```{r eval=FALSE}
install.packages("ggenealogy")
```


From bioconductor

```{r eval=FALSE}
if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))
    install.packages("BiocManager")

BiocManager::install("impute")
```

From github repos

```{r eval=FALSE}
remotes::install_github("hadley/emo")
```
